titleStmt.title: John W. Finnell, Receipt to A. A. Curtis
CWG13744

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 10; 1863 Office Expenses - Telegraph, Stationary - Transportation - Ordinance Stores; Bundle 6

body.p:
The State of Kentucky,
To A. A. Curtis Special Contractor Dr.

row.cell:
For rations issued to recruits under the command of Major Smith at Irvine Estill County from Novr 2019th. to Feby 13. 1863., as per accompanying abstract --
34,974 complete rations @ 153/4 cents

body.p:
Approved By order of the Governor
Jno. W. Finnell
Adjt Genl Ky vols.

I certify that the above account is correct and just; that the services ^rations^ were rendered ^furnished^ as stated; ^per contract,^ and that they were necessary for the public service and that they were necessary for the public service.

Received at Frankfort Ky, the 4 of March 1863, of Jno W. Finnell Adjt Genl, Quarter-master Kentucky Volunteers, the sum of Five thousand five hundred Dollars -- and twenty one Cents, in full of the above account.

NO. 12.
No. 99 Abstract B P Qr. 186
A. A. Curtis
Dollars 5500.21/100
Paid March 4 1863

The State of Kentucky,
To A. A. Curtis Special Contractor Dr.

row.cell:
For rations issued to recruits under the command of Major Smith at Irvine Estill County from Novr 19th. to Feby 13. 1863 as per accompanying abstract --
34,974 complete rations at 153/4 cents

body.p:
Approved By order of the Governor
Jno. W. Finnell
Adjt Genl Ky vols.
I certify that the above account is correct and just; that the services ^rations^ were rendered ^furnished^ as stated; ^per contract^ and that they were necessary for the public service.

Received at Frankfort Ky, the 4 of March 1863, of Jno W. Finnell Adjt Genl, Quarter-master Kentucky Volunteers, the sum of Five thousand five hundred Dollars and twenty one Cents, in full of the above account.

(DUPLICATE.)
A. A. Curtis
14
NO. 12.
No. 99 Abstract B P Qr. 186
A. A. Curtis
Dollars 5500.21/100
Paid March 4 1863
